active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'Security domain isolation is more critical in Zero Trust architectures than in traditional perimeter-based models.' Provide evidence from NIST SP 800-53 and SP 800-207, and connect to real-world breaches like SolarWinds. Identify strengths, limitations, and improvements.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Domain Isolation (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information Systems Security Capabilities > Security Architecture Design > Security Domain Isolation). Voter consensus (100% approval) emphasizes completeness (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3 Access Enforcement, AC-4 Information Flow Enforcement, SC-7 Boundary Protection), pedagogy (Bloom's progression, 4-layer scaffolding, active learning), and practical examples (VLANs, firewalls, Zero Trust per NIST SP 800-207). Generate 50-75 high-quality flashcards optimized for Anki/Spaced Repetition using the exact schema: - Front: Question - Back: {answer, explanation (reference scaffolding/NIST/research), bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, distractors (if MC)} Vary types: 30% remember/understand cloze, 40% apply/analyze MC (4 options, 1 correct), 30% evaluate/create open-ended. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the array above] - Scaffolding: [paste the scaffolding object above] - Active Learning: Tie explanations to prompts where relevant. - Research: Domain isolation limits breaches via segmentation; integrates least privilege, defense-in-depth, ZTA. Ensure coverage: 20% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. Distractors per protocol. Output as JSON array of flashcards.
